details.description: Albertosaurus is a bipedal predator with tiny, two-fingered hands and a massive head that had dozens of large, sharp teeth. It is at the top of the food chain in its local ecosystem.

Allosaurus is a large bipedal predator. Its skull is large and equipped with dozens of sharp, serrated teeth. It averages 28 ft in length. Relative to the large and powerful hindlimbs, its three-fingered forelimbs were small, and the body was balanced by a long and heavily muscled tail.

Ankylosaurus is a species of large, quadrupedal herbivore, adorned with a thick coating of spikes and bony plates. They are relatively low to the ground and protect themselves with an enormous bone club on the end of their tails.

The cervical vertebrae of the Apatosaurus is heavily constructed and the bones of the leg are very stocky despite long. Apatosaurus is a very robust animal. The tail is held above the ground during normal locomotion. Apatosaurus had a single claw on each forelimb and three on each hindlimb.

The Archaeopteryx has a unique blend of birdlike and reptilian features. Its body is covered in feathers starting at the neck. Its arms have much longer feathers, creating a set of primitive wings; its tail also features longer plumage. However, the face is scaly and more elongated, with needle sharp teeth in its mouth to shred apart insects. Additionally, the wings end in sharp claws.
This is a massive 16 foot wide turtle.
Argentinosaurus is between 98 and 115 feet in length and weighs up to 80 to 100 tons.
Assagim resemble lumpy blobs of flesh with 2 crude arms ending in claws.

Babau are around 7 feet tall and look like skeletons covered in a leathery black skin. The babau’s feet, taloned hands and head are grossly oversized, nearly the same as a hill giant’s. From the base of its skull protrudes a hooked horn.
Barbed devils do not need any hand weapons. They are quite proficient at using their hard, sharply-barbed claws and tail to beat their victims into submission.
Batrachians represent the more advanced frog-man tribes, and are typically armed with spear and shield or harpoon and shield.
Bearded devils are renowned for both their bloodthirstiness and their malicious cruelty.
Bone devils resemble large skeletons, covered in leathery white flesh, with a segmented tail like a scorpion.
Brachiosaurus has a disproportionately long neck, small skull, and large overall size. The forelimbs are longer than the hindlimbs, which results in a steeply inclined trunk, and its tail is shorter.

Bugbears are the largest of the goblinoids. They stand six foot tall and typically wear black leather adorned with studs and chains. Their shamans push wheeled fetishes in search of their long lost leader Harley.

The arched skull of Camarasaurus is very square and the blunt snout had many fenestrae, though it was sturdy. The teeth are shaped like chisels and arranged evenly along the jaw. Each front limb bares five toes, with the inner toe having a large sharpened claw. The front limbs are shorter than the hind legs, but the high position of the shoulders means there is little slope in the back.

The massive bodies of Centrosaurus are borne by stocky limbs. Centrosaurus bear single large horns over their noses. These horns curve forwards or backwards depending on the creature. Skull ornamentation is reduced as animals age.

Ceratosaurus is a large predatory dinosaur with large jaws containing blade-like teeth, a large, blade-like horn on the snout and a pair of hornlets over the eyes. The forelimbs were powerfully built but very short.
Cetiosaurus is a quadrupedal, long-necked, small-headed herbivore. It has a shorter tail and neck but long forelimbs. It is about 52 ft long and weighs 12 tons.
Charonosaurus has a long, backward-projecting hollow crest on its head, indicated by the huhly modified dorsal surface of the frontal bones.
Vrock are particularly stupid, and cannot normally be bargained with. They love the sight of precious gems and jewellery, however, and also enjoy feasting on the flesh of men.
Hezrou resemble loathsome toads with humanoid arms. They are known for their love of human flesh.
These muscular demons have a head like a horned dog, and from their broad chest sprouts four arms: 2 with sharp pincers and 2 with hands.

Particularly malevolent demons, the Nalfeshnee have the upper body of an ape and the cloven-hoofed lower body of a boar. They have rather small feathered wings as well, which seem undersized compared to their corpulent bodies.

Infamous even among demonkind for their cruel and ill-tempered nature, the marilith are invariably female. From the waist up they appear to be a full-figured human female with six arms and skin tones ranging from deep violet to a putrescent green. Below the waist however, they have the coiling body of a large serpent. In melee they prefer to wield a variety of barbed and hooked swords and battle axes or simply constrict their prey with their powerful serpentine tail.

Reportedly only six of this class of demon exist, each with their own secret name. In combat they wield massive swords and a cat-o-nine-tails whip which they employ to drag their victims into the flames that they continually immolate themselves in.
Cloud giants often dress in flowing clothing and fancy jewellery. They have bronze to white hair, with skin in tones of blue ranging from nearly white to cold, light blue.

Compsognathus has a slim and graceful build with a narrow head on top a snake-like neck and a few large osteoderms running down it's sides and back. Lean, quick-moving, and smart, they are common in wetter regions where their primary prey are in abundance. Compsognathus are highly social and are often found in groups.

Cyclopes are extremely tall, ugly humanoids, each with a single eye centred under its slightly drooping brow. These oafish, antisocial creatures prefer to inhabit lonesome environs, such as out-of-the-way, otherwise deserted islands.
Deinonychus reaches 11 feet in length, with a skull of 16 inches, a hip height of 3 feet and a weight of 160 pounds. It has powerful jaws lined with around seventy curved, blade-like teeth.

Demonettes are the result of union between a succubus and a human male. Their individual appearances vary, but their vestigial horns and small leathery bat-like wings denote their demonic heritage. Most favour their demonic mother and revel in evil. A minority harbour less demoniacal inclinations.
In normal lighting, devilcats are invisible. In total darkness however, they can be dimly seen as a glowing reddish aura resembling a large feline.

The most distinctive feature is their large skull, with a single horn on the snout, above the nostrils, and a pair of horns above each eye. They possess a sturdy build, with strong limbs, short hands with three hooves each, and short feet with four hooves each.

Dilophosaurus is a small opportunistic predator best distinguished by the twin crests on its head and the membranous frill surrounding its neck. They are found alone or in small groups and prey upon anything smaller than themselves.

A sail-backed quadruped, Dimetrodon is reptilian in appearance. The large sail on its back serves a thermoregulatory function, as it cools the animal on hot days and helps keep it warm on cold ones. They are fairly timid and sluggish, specializing in hunting prey that is smaller than themselves.
Diplodocus are very large, long-necked, quadrupedal animals, with long, whip-like tails. Their forelimbs are slightly shorter than their hind limbs, resulting in a largely horizontal posture.
Dretch are the weakest of all demonkind. Their appearance is almost comical, with a plump body with thin, gangly arms and legs. Their squat heads are bald and they have a slobbering, stupid visage.

The Dunkleosteus is a large fish with an eel-like tail and a very distinct head. The head is totally armoured, except for the eyes. Massive jagged plates of bone exist in its mouth to crush the shells and bones of its prey.

Dwarfs have a dark brown to deep tan coloured skin tone. They grow long beards and their hair colour tends towards browns and blacks. They favour dark sombre colours for their clothing, with flashes of bright colours. They are short but have stocky builds and are known for their great strength. In some campaign worlds, they may wear kilts.

Edmontosaurus is a bulky animal with a long, laterally flattened tail and a head with an expanded, duck-like beak. The fore legs were not as heavily built as the hind legs, but were long enough to be used in standing or movement.

Ekivu resemble a hideous crossbreed between a giant fly and a human. Their hindlegs are insect-like and their forelimbs resemble human arms, but with bony, sharp claws. Like flies, their bodies are covered in blueish-black chitin with bristling hair. Their heads are vaguely human, but with bulbous, faceted eyes like those of a fly. Their mouths are ringed with sharp teeth and their long noses are actually a sharp proboscis for drawing blood from their victims.

The Elasmosaurus has an almost teardrop-shaped body. Its size, long neck, and four whale-like flippers make it unmistakable for any other creature. The neck itself makes up half of the creature's length, and the mouth is lined with many sharp teeth.
An elf’s appearance is rather thin and pale. Although their hair is dark, their eyes are green. Elves like to dress in shades of blue, green, or violet.

Erinyes are unrelenting pursuers and prefer to capture their victims alive and return them to Hell for punishment. On occasion, erinyes may be willing to bargain, but they are quite crafty and will always try to tempt the bargainer into committing a great sin.
Euparkeria has an appearance similar to crocodiles, though faster.‭
Fire giants’ hair is the red and orange colour of flames, and their skin is soot black. Their teeth are flame orange, and their eyes red.

Flinds are close relatives of, and to a degree resemble, gnolls. Flinds stand 6 and a half foot tall, with powerful limbs and a leonine head. Both flinds and gnolls regard flinds as more highly evolved beings and any gnoll will regard a flind as having 16 charisma. Groups of gnolls are often led by one or more flinds and the gnolls will obey any order given by a flind without question. A gnoll defending its flind leader will not check for morale unless the flind is killed or incapacitated. Flinds share a common language with gnolls and can also speak bugbear, hobgoblin, ogrish, and orcish. Flinds are generally on friendly terms with these humanoid races and will work with them as need arises.
Frost giants have the overall appearance of giant, muscled barbarians. They have light yellow or blue eyes, with white hair that can likewise be tinged with yellow or blue.
The hide of a giant troll is reddish brown and they have tough wiry black hair, bulbous nose, and red rimmed eyes.

Gnolls are large hyena-faced creatures. They are covered in a grey fur with a dark muzzle and yellow mane. They have dark eyes, and long nails. Their armour is usually a mismatch of types taken from their victims.
Gnomes have wood brown skin, white hair, and light to deep blue eyes. They like to dress in leather and earthy colours, and wear lots of jewellery.
Goblins are small evil creatures with red eyes and a yellow to red coloured skin tone. They typically wear leather armour. They have an average lifespan of 50 years.
Gorgosaurus is a bipedal predator weighing more than four thousand points as an adult; dozens of large, sharp teeth lined its jaws, while its two-fingered forelimbs were comparatively small.

Grimlocks are a fierce race that dwell in the dark and hidden places of the earth, periodically issuing forth to the surface in search of prey, preferably human. Whilst somewhat resembling men in shape, they have a thick, almost scaly, hide that is a dusky grey in colour, a head of wild and matted black hair, a mouthful of vicious pointed teeth and two white featureless orbs for eyes.
A halfling has a rosy face with light brown to brown hair and brown to hazel eyes. Their clothes are simple earth colours, grey, tan, or brown.

In many ways hill giants resemble larger ogres, including having eyes red-rimmed, and they will often wield some type of bludgeoning weapon. They have skin of rust brown or tan, with similarly coloured rust or black hair. They dress in animal skins.
Hobgoblins are larger, hairier goblins with brown to grey fur. They have bright red or orange faces and yellow or brown coloured eyes. They are the religious leaders of the goblins.
Horned devils are inhabitants of the 6th and 7th planes of Hell. Although considered to be greater devils, they are weaker than either ice devils or pit fiends, whom they despise.
Hypacrosaurus has a tall, hollow rounded crest and tall neural spines.
Ice devils resemble upright remorhaz with humanoid arms and legs, and knotted, barbed tails.
An ice troll has the general form of a troll but its cold, semi-transparent body seems to have been chiselled from blue-tinged ice.

The Iguanodon is a medium herbivorous dinosaur with two spike-like thumbs for prying fruits open and stabbing would-be predators. They are as capable of walking on all fours as they are on just their hind legs.

Kobolds stand 3 foot tall and have a dark skin tone, with no hair. They are vaguely reptilian in appearance with scales, small horns on their heads, short snaky tails and red eyes. They have an average lifespan of 135 years and fervently believe in reincarnation.

Those unfortunate souls who are damned to the Abyss become kullules; the demonic horde. The most evilly accursed among them are bound to spend eternity wandering the flaming tiers of Gehenna. They are only semi-intelligent, instinctively driven to blindly attack by tooth and nail any being not of demonkind.
Lemures are the primal form of evil souls damned to spend eternity in Hell. They are only vaguely humanoid, with crude arms and heads.
Their hides are tough and leathery, and are colored in many different shades of green. They have cold black eyes, and hard nails on their fingers. Some have a bony ridge along their backs.
One horned herbivore. Not purple. Doesn't fly.

An enormous marine lizard, Mosasaurus is one of the largest creatures found in the water. It has four flippers to propel its massive body. A small, finned ridge runs down the length of its back before developing into a paddle-like tail.
Nothosaurus is a seal like dinosaur that uses its tail, legs, and webbed feet to propel and steer it through the water. The skull is broad and flat, with long jaws, lined with needle teeth.
Ogres are malicious beings who live in all environments, whether above or below ground.

Ogre magi are known to have thick skin that usually ranges in colour from pale yellow to brown or black, but some are said to be green or even blue. Most have reddish coloured eyes, two or more yellow to white horns, thick tusks, sharp yellow to black nails and long dark hair.

Orcs are filthy, disgusting creatures with a brown or brownish-green coloured skin tone. Their hair is a nest of black or dark brown. They wear rusty and misused armour. They have an average lifespan of 40 years.
Ornitholestes is a bipedal carnivore with a short neck, long whiplike tail, and long forelimbs.

Pentaceratops is large at 6 yards long. The skull is 7 feet with a small nose horn pointing upwards and backwards. The brow horns are very long and curving strongly forwards. The somewhat upward tilted frill is long, with two large holes in it. The torso of Pentaceratops is tall and wide.

Plateosaurus has a small skull, a long and flexible neck, a stocky body, and a long, mobile tail. The arms of Plateosaurus were very short, however, they are strongly built, with hands adapted for powerful grasping. The hind limbs are held under the body, with slightly flexed knees and ankles.

The Plesiosaur has an almost teardrop-shaped body. Its size, long neck, and four whale-like flippers make it unmistakable for any other creature. The neck itself makes up half of the creature's length, and the mouth is lined with many sharp teeth.
The Pteranodon has a long crest and beak filled with needle-like teeth, as well as impressive wings.
The Pterodactyl has a long crest and beak filled with needle-like teeth, as well as impressive wings.

Quetzalcoatlus is a gigantic, long-necked pterosaur. These creatures are solitary and far-ranging, moving to roost and feed. They are carnivorous, feeding mainly on fish and small game taken from the ground. In addition, they scavenge.
The jaws of Rhamphorhynchus are filled with sharp needle like teeth,‭ ‬twenty in the top,‭ ‬fourteen in the bottom.
The most distinctive feature of Saurolophus is its cranial crest. It is long and spike-like and projects upward and backward at about a 45 degree angle, starting from over the eyes.

Saurophaganax is a very large Morrison allosaurid characterized by horizontal laminae at the bases of the dorsal neural spines above the transverse processes, and meat-chopper chevrons. The maximum size
These devils resemble humanoids with large, bulbous heads and small, evil features. Their wings are black with silver tips.
Shantungosaurus has a toothless beak, and jaws packed with around 1,500 tiny chewing teeth. A large hole near its nostrils is covered by a loose flap of skin, which can be inflated to make sounds.
Shub resemble deformed humanoids, with hunchbacks, twisted arms and legs, and a strange, loping gait. Their pinhead skulls are bald, and their pointed ears flop down.
Soul worms are the remains of the most base and any evil souls who have been imprisoned in Hell for eternity. Their appearance is similar to a putrescent maggot with a leering humanoid face.
Spiked devils have scaly reddish skin and bat-like wings. A row of dark spines runs from their forehead to the base of their tail. Both their hands and feet have sharp claws.

The Stegosaurus appears as a large quadrupedal herbivore with distinctive plates on its back, which are often vibrantly colored. The dinosaur also possesses 3 pairs of spikes on the end of its long tail, and has a small head tipped with a beak as well as a few grinding teeth.

Stone giants are partially named for their stone-like complexions and iron coloured eyes. Their hair is also dark-stone coloured, sometimes with hints of blue. Stone giants prefer stone clubs and wear skins the colour of stone.
Storm Giants have purple skin, eyes either purple or cloudy grey, and blue-tinted black hair.

Styracosaurus are 18 feet long and weigh around 3 tons. The skull is massive, with a large nostril, a tall straight nose horn, and a neck frill crowned with at least four large spikes. Each of the four longest frill spines is comparable in length to the nose horn.Individuals of the Styracosaurus genus were approximately 5.5 metres (18 ft) long as adults and weighed around 2.7 tonnes.[2] The skull was massive, with a large nostril, a tall straight nose horn, and a parietosquamosal frill (a neck frill) crowned with at least four large spikes. Each of the four longest frill spines was comparable in length to the nose horn, at 50 to 55 centimetres (20 to 22 inches) long.[3] The nasal horn is estimated at 57 centimeters (22 inches) long in the type specimen,[4] but the horn is only partially complete. Based on other nasal horn cores from Styracosaurus and Centrosaurus, this horn may have come to a rounded point at around half of that length.
These solitary demons are always female. In their true form they look like stunningly beautiful, and naked, humanoid women with leathery bat-wings sprouting from their back.

Tarbosaurus is a large bipedal predator, weighing up to five tonnes and equipped with about sixty large teeth. It has a unique locking mechanism in its lower jaw and the smallest forelimbs relative to body size of all tyrannosaurids, renowned for their disproportionately tiny, two-fingered forelimbs.
Telmatosaurus is a relatively small hadrosaur, approximately 16 feet long.

The most distinctive feature is their large skull, with a single horn on the snout, above the nostrils, and a pair of horns above each eye. They possess a sturdy build, with strong limbs, short hands with three hooves each, and short feet with four hooves each.

Troglodyte skin is normally a dark green colour. However, they have the ability to alter this colouration depending on the area around them (much like a chameleon). They have bony fins along their skulls, and dark reptilian eyes.
The hides of trolls are a sickly green or grey and they have cold black eyes.

Tyrannosaurus is a bipedal carnivore with a massive skull balanced by a long, heavy tail. Relative to its large and powerful hindlimbs, Tyrannosaurus fore limbs were short but unusually powerful for their size and had two clawed digits.

The uduk, or the ‘jumping demon’, looks much like an orang-utan with a horribly twisted face. Its hands and feet are taloned and have 6 digits each. The uduk can move on foot along the ground, but they excel at swinging through areas of dense foliage.

The Velociraptor is a relatively small dinosaur with feathers on the head, back, tail, and on the backs of the arms. They come in a variety of colors, although green and reddish brown are the most common.
